alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Lewis and Southern Nez Perce Counties; Lewiston Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 20 at 6:59PM MST until February 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Localized stronger winds will be possible over the Waterville Plateau and lower Columbia Basin near the Columbia River and near the Blue Mountains near Pomeroy and Alpowa Summit. * WHERE...Osburn, St. Maries, Clarkston, Moses Lake, Ritzville, Mansfield, Kellogg, Creston, Pinehurst, Hayden, Soldiers Meadow Road, Wilbur, Lookout Pass, Nezperce, Wenatchee, Post Falls, Kamiah, Pomeroy, Alpowa Summit, Chelan, Waterville, Fairfield, Mullan, Rockford, Entiat, Dobson Pass, Gifford, Davenport, Othello, Spokane Valley, Winchester, Lewiston Grade, Airway Heights, Cashmere, Quincy, Number 2 Canyon, Worley, Fernwood, Peck, Ephrata, Wallace, Lewiston, Pangborn Airport, Fourth Of July Pass, Harrington, Craigmont, Coeur d`Alene, Number 1 Canyon, Coulee City, Lapwai, Downtown Spokane, Grand Coulee, Culdesac, Cheney, Odessa, and Badger Mountain Road. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Lewis and Southern Nez Perce Counties; Lewiston Area
